title: Compensation for victims of terrorist attacks abroad

details.description: Compensation for terrorist attacks abroad - eligibility, acts of terrorism covered, application form, advice line
details.body:
You may be able to claim compensation if you’ve been a victim of terrorism abroad.

You can claim if you:

  • were injured in a specific act of terrorism - known as a ‘designated act’
  • have a disability that was caused by your injuries
  • are a British, EU, EEA or Swiss citizen
  • lived in the UK for 3 years before the act of terrorism happened

You can’t claim if you’ve recovered from your injuries or if you were bereaved.

Terrorist acts you can claim for

You can make a claim for the following:

  • attacks in Mumbai, India (26 November 2008)
  • bombings in Marmaris, Turkey (27 August 2006)
  • bombings in Dahab, Egypt (24 April 2006)
  • attacks against tourist sites in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt (23 July 2005)
  • bombings in Kusadasi, Turkey (16 July 2005)
  • bombings in Bali, Indonesia (12 October 2002)

How to claim

To claim, send an application form to the Ministry of Justice.

Download ‘Victims of overseas terrorism - application form’ (PDF, 250KB)
